meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for drinking.
meanings.sent1: The potability of the water was tested before allowing anyone to drink it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to check the potability of the tap water before using it for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The jokester claimed his jokes had the potability of a refreshing glass of water.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had the potability of a cool drink on a hot day, refreshing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The potability of the soup was so high that people lined up to have a taste.

meanings.definition: The ability of a liquid to be safely consumed.
meanings.sent1: Before drinking from the stream, they checked the potability of the water.
meanings.sent2: The potability of the milk was questionable after being left out for hours.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed his potion had the potability of a magical elixir.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the potability of a toxic substance, poisoning the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The potability of the juice was so low that no one dared to take a sip.
